articles.headline: Trump Releases Mideast Peace Plan That Strongly Favors Israel
articles.snippet: The plan would discard the longtime goal of granting the Palestinians a full-fledged state. President Trump called it “a win-win” for both sides; Palestinian leaders immediately rejected it.
articles.abstract: The plan would discard the longtime goal of granting the Palestinians a full-fledged state. President Trump called it “a win-win” for both sides; Palestinian leaders immediately rejected it.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Tuesday unveiled his long-awaited Middle East peace plan with a flourish, releasing a proposal that would give Israel most of what it has sought over decades of conflict while offering the Palestinians the possibility of a state with limited sovereignty.
articles.byline: By Michael Crowley and David M. Halbfinger

articles.headline: Trump’s Defense Team Discounts Bolton as Republicans Work to Hold Off Witnesses
articles.snippet: The president’s legal team completed its impeachment defense and Republicans huddled to discuss whether to call new witnesses.
articles.abstract: The president’s legal team completed its impeachment defense and Republicans huddled to discuss whether to call new witnesses.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s defense team appealed to the Senate on Tuesday to disregard a new account by the former national security adviser John R. Bolton that bolsters the impeachment case against the president. But by day’s end, Republican leaders working feverishly to block testimony from Mr. Bolton or other witnesses indicated they had not yet corralled the votes to do so.

articles.headline: How the Fed Chairman Is Shielding It From Trump
articles.snippet: Jerome H. Powell is a pragmatist, and one who is quietly insulating an embattled Federal Reserve often in President Trump’s cross hairs.
articles.abstract: Jerome H. Powell is a pragmatist, and one who is quietly insulating an embattled Federal Reserve often in President Trump’s cross hairs.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Jerome H. Powell has spent much of his life toiling quietly behind the scenes, first as an investment banker and later as a governor at the Federal Reserve. Even as the central bank’s chair, and arguably the global economy’s most important figure, he has maintained a low-key image.

articles.headline: A Deal That Has Two Elections, Rather Than Mideast Peace, as Its Focus
articles.snippet: The Israeli-Palestinian peace plan unveiled by President Trump and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu sounds more like a road map for their own futures than for the Middle East.
articles.abstract: The Israeli-Palestinian peace plan unveiled by President Trump and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu sounds more like a road map for their own futures than for the Middle East.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A president trying to prevail in an impeachment trial stood with an Israeli prime minister under indictment on Tuesday to announce a long-delayed plan for resolving the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, and the result sounded more like a road map for their own futures than for the Middle East.

articles.headline: For John Bolton, an ‘Upside-Down World’ After Trump Revelation
articles.snippet: Democrats who once derided him now want him to testify at President Trump’s impeachment trial while some of his erstwhile Republican friends are throwing him to the curb.
articles.abstract: Democrats who once derided him now want him to testify at President Trump’s impeachment trial while some of his erstwhile Republican friends are throwing him to the curb.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Not long ago, they called him “too extreme,” “aggressively and dangerously wrong” and “downright dangerous.” They called him “nutty,” “reckless” and “far outside the mainstream.”

articles.headline: A Warehouse Robot Learns to Sort Out the Tricky Stuff
articles.snippet: At a facility near Berlin, a new kind of robot is automating tasks that until recently had been out of the reach of machines.
articles.abstract: At a facility near Berlin, a new kind of robot is automating tasks that until recently had been out of the reach of machines.
articles.lead_paragraph: LUDWIGSFELDE, Germany — Inside a warehouse on the outskirts of Berlin, a long line of blue crates moved down a conveyor belt, carrying light switches, sockets and other electrical parts. As they came to a stop, five workers picked through the small items, placing each one in a cardboard box.
articles.byline: By Adam Satariano and Cade Metz

articles.headline: Boeing Expects 737 Max Costs Will Surpass $18 Billion
articles.snippet: The grounding of the 737 Max jet continues to drag on the company’s results.
articles.abstract: The grounding of the 737 Max jet continues to drag on the company’s results.
articles.lead_paragraph: Boeing said on Wednesday that the costs associated with the grounding of the 737 Max were likely to surpass $18 billion, a significant increase over earlier forecasts.
